title: M Sinar — The finest park homes
summary: A new oasis of tranquil living amid the hustle and bustle of the metropolis is ready to be unveiled at Southville City, a sanctuary south of Kuala Lumpur. Developer Mah Sing Group Bhd will be launching the latest parcel in the thriving township, the M Sinar serviced apartment, on June 29. Various activities, including a mini petting zoo and planting workshops, have been lined up for that day. The sales gallery and show unit of M Sinar at Mah Sing’s Southville City are now open for viewing.
content: The entrance to M Sinar is set to not only make a statement, but also leave a lasting impression on visitors

title: Digital banks could spur rise in mule accounts
summary: In recent months, Malaysia has witnessed a worrying surge in the number of mule accounts, which are increasingly being used money laundering and identity theft. The ease of acquiring the accounts has made the country a prime target for foreign syndicates looking to launder and legitimise their illicit funds.
content: This article first appeared in Digital Edge, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on June 24, 2024 - June 30, 2024

summary: The shortage of doctors and essential resources has been a persistent, unsolved problem in hospitals and the healthcare sector in general. content:
This article first appeared in Digital Edge, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on June 24, 2024 - June 30, 2024

The shortage of doctors and essential resources has been a persistent, unsolved problem in hospitals and the healthcare sector in general. The Ministry of Health’s 2023 Health Facts reveals that there is one doctor to 412 Malaysians, or 2.4 doctors for 1,000 people. title: Talent: Rejecting hustle culture isn’t being lazy, it’s being smart
summary:
Not so long ago, the “work hard, play hard” mentality seemed to be everywhere. Influencers across the media promoted waking up early and putting in more hours than anyone else as the ultimate path to success.

On the surface, their logic makes sense. Those who work the most deserve the g...
content:
This article first appeared in Digital Edge, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on June 24, 2024 - June 30, 2024

Not so long ago, the “work hard, play hard” mentality seemed to be everywhere. Influencers across the media promoted waking up early and putting in more hours than anyone else as the ultimate path to success.

On the surface, their logic makes sense. Those who work the most deserve the greatest rewards, right?

title: Cover Story: Are SMEs ready for e-invoicing?
summary: As the Aug 1 deadline approaches for the first batch of taxpayers — those with an annual turnover of RM100 million and above — to adopt e-invoicing for all their transactions, smaller businesses are bracing for their turn on Jan 1 and July 1 next year. However, concerns over this are already surf...
content:
This article first appeared in Digital Edge, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on June 24, 2024 - June 30, 2024

As the Aug 1 deadline approaches for the first batch of taxpayers — those with an annual turnover of RM100 million and above — to adopt e-invoicing for all their transactions, smaller businesses are bracing for their turn on Jan 1 and July 1 next year. However, concerns over this are already surfacing among companies and industry groups.

title: Report: AI-driven innovations amplify human abilities
summary: The rise of artificial intelligence (AI) has sparked concerns about its potential to replace human expertise. However, a recent report by Citi GPS: Global Perspectives and Solutions emphasises a different future, one of human-machine collaboration. This collaborative approach leverages AI’s stren...
content:
This article first appeared in Digital Edge, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on June 24, 2024 - June 30, 2024

The rise of artificial intelligence (AI) has sparked concerns about its potential to replace human expertise. However, a recent report by Citi GPS: Global Perspectives and Solutions emphasises a different future, one of human-machine collaboration. This collaborative approach leverages AI’s strengths to augment human capabilities, fostering significant productivity gains.

title: Ministry backs Westports expansion project
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Transport Ministry fully supports Westports Holdings’ expansion project in Port Klang known as Westports Malaysia 2.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The Transport Ministry fully supports Westports Holdings’ expansion project in Port Klang known as Westports Malaysia 2.

Transport Minister Anthony Loke said a new concession agreement for Westports has been approved by the Cabinet, following an evaluation by the Public Private Partnership Unit and the agreement was ratified at the end of last year.

He said the expansion aims to double the port’s capacity from 14 million twenty-foot equivalent units (TEUs

title: Joining BRICS will not affect
E&E sector
summary: KULIM: Malaysia’s plan to join intergovernmental organisation BRICS (Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa) will not adversely impact its electrical and electronics (E&E) sector, says Science, Technology and Innovation Minister Chang Lih Kang.
content:
KULIM: Malaysia’s plan to join intergovernmental organisation BRICS (Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa) will not adversely impact its electrical and electronics (E&E) sector, says Science, Technology and Innovation Minister Chang Lih Kang.

He said Malaysia is prepared to join the grouping as this is seen as offering numerous benefits to the country including in terms of research and development in the E&E sector.

title: Dubai’s real estate stays resilient this time around
summary: DUBAI: Dubai’s red-hot real estate market is defying predictions of a slowdown, in a sign that the Middle Eastern business hub might be breaking free from its boom-and-bust cycles.
content:
An aircraft from the Emirates company flies over Dubai on May 15, 2024. (Photo by Giuseppe CACACE / AFP)

DUBAI: Dubai’s red-hot real estate market is defying predictions of a slowdown, in a sign that the Middle Eastern business hub might be breaking free from its boom-and-bust cycles.

“Prices are continuing to rise and the transient nature of Dubai seems to be well and truly over,” Taimur Khan, the head of research at global property advisory fir

title: MRL: Progress of ECRL project in Kelantan reaches 79.81%
summary: KOTA BHARU (June 23): The construction of the East Coast Railway Link (ECRL) in Kelantan, covering 43 kilometres (km), has reached a progress of 79.81% as of last month, said Malaysia Rail Link Sdn Bhd (MRL) chief executive officer Datuk Seri Darwis Abdul Razak.
content:
KOTA BHARU (June 23): The construction of the East Coast Railway Link (ECRL) in Kelantan, covering 43 kilometres (km), has reached a progress of 79.81% as of last month, said Malaysia Rail Link Sdn Bhd (MRL) chief executive officer Datuk Seri Darwis Abdul Razak.

He said the progress aligns with the project schedule for the expected completion of the railway line from Kota Bharu to Terminal Bersepadu Gombak (integrated transport terminal). 

He said Kelantan

title: MPs urged to turn up at Dewan Rakyat sittings — Mohamad Hasan
summary: PUTRAJAYA (June 23): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim held a pre-council meeting with Unity Government Members of Parliament (MPs) at Seri Perdana on Sunday.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (June 23): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim held a pre-council meeting with Unity Government Members of Parliament (MPs) at Seri Perdana on Sunday.

The meeting is as preparation before the Dewan Rakyat sitting for the second meeting of the third session of the 15th Parliament, from Monday (June 24) to July 18.

"Everyone has been asked to attend Parliament on Monday. Don’t be absent,” Foreign Minister Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan told the media when

title: Targeted diesel subsidy among issues discussed in Dewan Rakyat pre-council meeting, says Loke
summary: PUTRAJAYA (June 23): Issues related to the diesel subsidy rationalisation were among matters discussed in the pre-council meeting for the next Dewan Rakyat sitting to be held from Monday (June 24) to July 18.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (June 23): Issues related to the diesel subsidy rationalisation were among matters discussed in the pre-council meeting for the next Dewan Rakyat sitting to be held from Monday (June 24) to July 18.

Transport Minister Anthony Loke said the meeting, held on Sunday afternoon at Seri Perdana, also discussed several matters related to bills to be debated during the parliamentary session.

"This is a regular pre-council meeting before Parliament convene

title: Wholesaler charged with 116 counts of failing to submit documents on diesel purchase for export
summary: KOTA BHARU (June 23): A wholesaler pleaded not guilty in the Sessions Court here on Sunday to 116 charges of failing to submit documents on his diesel purchase, worth more than RM10 million, for export, and not maintaining a record of the diesel stock.
content:
KOTA BHARU (June 23): A wholesaler pleaded not guilty in the Sessions Court here on Sunday to 116 charges of failing to submit documents on his diesel purchase, worth more than RM10 million, for export, and not maintaining a record of the diesel stock.

Mohd Fared Ramli, 36, the proprietor of Wau Beremas Enterprise, made the plea after the charges were read out before judge Zulkifli Abllah.

He was charged with committing all of the offences at a premise

title: Malaysia’s proactive measures enhance its position in global FDI landscape — UN report
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (June 23): Malaysia's proactive measures and favourable investment policies have strategically positioned it well in the global foreign direct investment (FDI) landscape, according to the United Nations Trade and Development (UNCTAD) World Investment Report 2024.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 23): Malaysia's proactive measures and favourable investment policies have strategically positioned it well in the global foreign direct investment (FDI) landscape, according to the United Nations Trade and Development (UNCTAD) World Investment Report 2024.

The report, released on June 20, highlighted a slew of strategic initiatives mulled by Malaysia, ranging from assistance in obtaining specific permits to comprehensive support for foreign investors.

title: Who profits from the soaring price of cocoa?
summary: PARIS: Though cocoa prices on the financial markets have soared, the rise is benefiting cocoa growers, bean processors, speculators and chocolatiers in unequal measure.In March, prices rocketed to more than US$10,000 a tonne in New York after a poor ...
content:
PARIS: Though cocoa prices on the financial markets have soared, the rise is benefiting cocoa growers, bean processors, speculators and chocolatiers in unequal measure.

In March, prices rocketed to more than US$10,000 a tonne in New York after a poor harvest in West Africa due to a combination of bad weather conditions and disease devastating ageing plantations.

They have since fallen back from the peak, yet are still three times higher than last year.

In Ivory Coast and Ghana, the world's largest cocoa produce

title: Yaccarino shakes up X amid Musk's pressure on costs, FT says
summary: The chief executive of social media platform X, Linda Yaccarino, has shaken up her inner circle in the face of pressure from owner Elon Musk to boost sales and cut costs, the Financial Times said on Sunday.This month Yaccarino ...
content:
The chief executive of social media platform X, Linda Yaccarino, has shaken up her inner circle in the face of pressure from owner Elon Musk to boost sales and cut costs, the Financial Times said on Sunday.

This month Yaccarino fired her right-hand man and head of business operations and communications, Joe Benarroch, the newspaper said, citing three people familiar with the matter.

X did not immediately respond to Reuters request for comment on the report.

Before joining X, then known as Twitter, in June 2023, Bena

title: Nik Nazmi: Cleaning of oil spill in Pengerang waters to complete by coming Saturday
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (June 23): Cleaning works of the oil spill in the waters of Pengerang, Johor, which started on Saturday (June 22) morning, is scheduled to be completed by the coming Saturday (June 29), said Minister of Natural Resources and Environmental Sustainability Nik Nazmi Nik Ahmad.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 23): Cleaning works of the oil spill in the waters of Pengerang, Johor, which started on Saturday (June 22) morning, is scheduled to be completed by the coming Saturday (June 29), said Minister of Natural Resources and Environmental Sustainability Nik Nazmi Nik Ahmad.

He said phase one of the cleaning works, involving collecting oily waste by an appointed contractor, had reached 95%, while phase two, involving spraying rocky areas and cleaning pebble stones

title: IJN to pay Theta Edge RM1.3m to settle dispute over record management system contract termination
summary: KUALA LUMPUR:  Theta Edge Bhd on Friday announced that its unit will receive RM1.3 million from Institut Jantung Negara (IJN)  as settlement of a dispute over the termination of a hospital information management system and electronic medical record contract, two-years ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR:  Theta Edge Bhd on Friday announced that its unit will receive RM1.3 million from Institut Jantung Negara (IJN)  as settlement of a dispute over the termination of a hospital information management system and electronic medical record contract, two-years into the contract.

Theta Edge's Theta Technologies Sdn Bhd (TTSB) was awarded a four-year development contract worth RM25.2 million (inclusive of service tax) by IJN on Feb 25, 2021.

On Mar 17, 2023, TTSB was given notice of termination of the contract

title: Sungai Bakap state by-election: Joohari wants to make inroads into ‘grey area’
summary: NIBONG TEBAL (June 23): Focusing on local community issues, Pakatan Harapan (PH) candidate for the Sungai Bakap state by-election Dr Joohari Ariffin will continue to draw closer to the voters and work hard to make inroads into the “grey area”.
content:
NIBONG TEBAL (June 23): Focusing on local community issues, Pakatan Harapan (PH) candidate for the Sungai Bakap state by-election Dr Joohari Ariffin will continue to draw closer to the voters and work hard to make inroads into the “grey area”.

Joohari said he will focus on issues related to water, infrastructure and roads to try and win back the Sungai Bakap state seat which it lost to PAS in the 2023 state election.

summary: KUALA LUMPUR: A seamless online-offline experience is now recognised as a fundamental requirement for retailers in the rapidly evolving retail and commerce landscape.According to a study by KPMG and GS1, an international standards organisation with member bodies in more ...

title: Loke: Driving institutes involved in corruption face licence cancellation
summary: SEREMBAN (June 23): Driving institutes have been warned not to be involved in illegal “kopi O” driving licence syndicates, as they may face immediate revocation of their operating licences.
content:
SEREMBAN (June 23): Driving institutes have been warned not to be involved in illegal “kopi O” driving licence syndicates, as they may face immediate revocation of their operating licences.

Transport Minister Anthony Loke said that corrupt activities during driving tests must be stopped because such actions endanger the lives of road users, especially the youth.

“Driving schools must not engage in corruption. If this issue is not curbed, young people w

title: PM: Govt committed to reducing carbon footprint, promoting sustainable practices
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (June 23): The Madani government is committed to reducing the country’s carbon footprint and promoting sustainable practices, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 23): The Madani government is committed to reducing the country’s carbon footprint and promoting sustainable practices, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

It has implemented multifaceted policies aimed at reducing carbon emissions, promoting social equity, creating new growth opportunities in the green economy, and ensuring transparent governance, he said.

title: Rehda expects Mapex 2024 to exceed RM30 mln in sales value
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Real Estate and Housing Developers' Association Malaysia (Rehda) is targeting a sales value of more than RM30 million at the three-day Malaysia Property Exposition (MAPEX) 2024.Rehda vice-president Datuk Chan Kin Meng said the target was set due ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The Real Estate and Housing Developers' Association Malaysia (Rehda) is targeting a sales value of more than RM30 million at the three-day Malaysia Property Exposition (MAPEX) 2024.

Rehda vice-president Datuk Chan Kin Meng said the target was set due to sales of RM30 million raked in over the weekend during the previous MAPEX.

"The expo remains relevant as a one-stop centre for homebuyers to compare prices and attractive offers since its inception in 1998," he said when met after launching MAPEX 2024 he

title: Domestic Trade Ministry coordinating appeals from transportation sector for diesel subsidy — Armizan
summary: PUTRAJAYA (June 23): The Ministry of Domestic Trade and Cost of Living (KPDN) is coordinating appeals from certain transport sectors that want to participate in the Subsidised Diesel Control System (SKDS) to be forwarded to the Appeals Committee.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (June 23): The Ministry of Domestic Trade and Cost of Living (KPDN) is coordinating appeals from certain transport sectors that want to participate in the Subsidised Diesel Control System (SKDS) to be forwarded to the Appeals Committee.

Its minister Datuk Armizan Mohd Ali said the matter would then be brought to the Cabinet meeting for consideration.

He said immediate approval will be given to applications that are complete, covering 33

title: Malaysia Airlines, Huawei team up to gain deeper insights into traveller preference, market trends
summary: Malaysia Airlines Bhd has teamed up with China’s leading telecommunications equipment and services provider Huawei to leverage Huawei’s digital technologies as part of efforts to gain deeper insights into traveller preferences and analyse market trends.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 23): Malaysia Airlines Bhd has teamed up with China’s leading telecommunications equipment and services provider Huawei to leverage Huawei’s digital technologies as part of efforts to gain deeper insights into traveller preferences and analyse market trends.

In a statement on Sunday, Malaysia Airlines said it has entered into a strategic partnership aimed at revolutionising the airline’s digital landscape through Huawei consumer cloud services’ advanced digital solutions.

title: Transport ministry supports Westports Malaysia 2 expansion project
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Ministry of Transport fully supports Westports Holdings' expansion project in Port Klang known as Westports Malaysia 2.Transport Minister Anthony Loke said a new concession agreement for Westports has been approved by the Cabinet, following an evaluation by ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The Ministry of Transport fully supports Westports Holdings' expansion project in Port Klang known as Westports Malaysia 2.

Transport Minister Anthony Loke said a new concession agreement for Westports has been approved by the Cabinet, following an evaluation by the Public Private Partnership Unit (UKAS), and the agreement was ratified at the end of last year.

He said the expansion aims to double the port's capacity from 14 million twenty-foot equivalent units (TEUs) to 28 million TEUs.

title: Ringgit likely to trend lower versus US dollar next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is likely to trade lower against the US dollar next week, maintaining a range near 4.71.Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said that next week, the market players will be focusing ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is likely to trade lower against the US dollar next week, maintaining a range near 4.71.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said that next week, the market players will be focusing on the final first-quarter 2024 (1Q 2024) gross domestic product (GDP) figures for the United States (US).

"The first 1Q 2024 GDP estimate was 1.6 per cent in April, and the second estimate came in lower at 1.3 per cent in May.

title: Bursa Malaysia likely to remain in consolidation mode next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to stay in consolidation mode next week until fresh catalysts emerge, said an analyst.Rakuten Trade Sdn Bhd equity research vice-president Thong Pak Leng said, nonetheless, the online broker still holds a positive long-term ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to stay in consolidation mode next week until fresh catalysts emerge, said an analyst.

Rakuten Trade Sdn Bhd equity research vice-president Thong Pak Leng said, nonetheless, the online broker still holds a positive long-term view on the local market, supported by attractive valuations, robust corporate earnings, and improving economic conditions.

"Based on our technical analysis, the FBM KLCI gapped down on Thursday, marking its ninth consecutive black candle and the benchmark inde

title: A roaring success
summary: HSBC started in this part of the world in 1884, with its first branch in Penang. This was in line with the bank’s origins, having been founded in Hong Kong and Shanghai to facilitate trade and commerce. To mark its 140-year presence in the country, CEO Datuk Omar Siddiq, CEO of HSBC Bank Malaysia discusses how it has been a key player in the country’s development narrative, the evolution of our banking system and how he is driving the bank’s growth alongside its people.
content: KUALA LUMPUR (June 23): HSBC started in this part of the world in 1884, with its first branch in Penang. This was in line with the bank’s origins, having been founded in Hong Kong and Shanghai to facilitate trade and commerce. To mark its 140-year presence in the country, Datuk Omar Siddiq, the chief executive officer of HSBC Bank Malaysia, discusses how it has been a key player in the country’s development narrative, the evolution of our banking system, and how he is driving the bank’s growth alongside its people.

title: Aiming high
summary: Almost a year after its listing on the local bourse, SkyWorld Development Bhd (KL:SKYWLD) has launched various strategies to grow its businesses further, such as expansion outside of Kuala Lumpur, maiden overseas ventures as well as property investment. All these are expected to help in tripling the company’s market capitalisation in five years, according to chief executive officer Lee Chee Seng.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 23): Almost a year after its listing on the local bourse, SkyWorld Development Bhd (KL:SKYWLD) has launched various strategies to grow its businesses further, such as expansion outside of Kuala Lumpur, maiden overseas ventures as well as property investment. All these are expected to help in tripling the company’s market capitalisation in five years, according to chief executive officer Lee Chee Seng.

title: Political stability, clear policies have propelled Sarawak as new economic giant, says PM
summary: KUCHING (June 23): The political stability and clear policies upheld by Sarawak's leadership have enabled the state to emerge as a new economic powerhouse in Malaysia.
content:
KUCHING (June 23): The political stability and clear policies upheld by Sarawak's leadership have enabled the state to emerge as a new economic powerhouse in Malaysia.

Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim said Sarawak has demonstrated impressive economic growth, contributing to increased interest from foreign investors.

Speaking at the Sarawak 2024 Gawai Dayak celebration dinner here on Saturday (June 22) night, he said last year’s investment figures wer

title: Elections not the venue to determine voters’ religious beliefs, says Saifuddin Nasution
summary: NIBONG TEBAL (June 23): Elections are not the venue for certain parties to determine voters’ religious beliefs, but should instead be a platform for political parties to explain their plans and agenda for the people, should they emerge victorious, Parti Keadilan Rakyat (PKR) secretary general Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail, who is also the minister of home affairs, said.
content:
NIBONG TEBAL (June 23): Elections are not the venue for certain parties to determine voters’ religious beliefs, but should instead be a platform for political parties to explain their plans and agenda for the people, should they emerge victorious, Parti Keadilan Rakyat (PKR) secretary general Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail, who is also the minister of home affairs, said.

Should any party attempt to do so, they should not be supported in any campaign, he added.
